result.execSummary:
The defendant Bernabe Perez-Camacho was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Bernabe Perez-Camacho is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Bernabe Perez-Camacho was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Bernabe Perez-Camacho was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Bernabe Perez-Camacho was found guilty of OWI (2nd) [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: CONCURRENT w/Ct.2 and file 14CF21 but CONSECUTIVE to any other prison sentence he is serving.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Counseling shall specifically include:  Anger management / DV counseling.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*  Cts.1&2 - Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.  May not have contact with Laura Tolstyga, unless otherwise permitted by the court only.  Complete domestic violence counseling.  Take prescription medications as prescribed.  Inform DOC of all doctors and sign confidential release of information.  Actively participate in addressing criminogenic records.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due. Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*  Ct.3 - Pay fine of $350.00 and court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
Spend 30 days in the county jail w/huber privileges.  Consecutive to prison sentence.  Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.  May not have contact with Laura Tolstyga, unless otherwise permitted by the court only.  Complete DV counseling.  Take prescription medications as prescribed.  Inform DOC of all doctors and sign confidential release of information.  Actively participate in addressing criminogenic records.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Denise Hertz-McGrath.  Clerk: PT
Sentencing arguments made. 
Counts 1 & 2 - DE is sentenced to 4 years in the WSP forthwith; 1 year Initial Confinement followed by 3 years Extended Supervision.  Counts 1 & 2 are concurrent and concurrent to 14CF21, but consecutive to any other prison sentence he is serving.  DE is eligible for CIP and SAP.  
Count 3 -   Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on probation for 1 year with conditions.  See conditions.  Count 3 is concurrent to 12CF758, but consecutive to Counts 1 & 2.  As a condition court imposes 30 days in the KCJ consecutive to Counts 1 & 2.  Huber & Work Crew authorized.  Fined $350 plus costs and Cash Bond on deposit in 14CF21 to be applied and any unpaid financial obligations that remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  Atty Hertz McGrath to submit a letter to the court by 8/25/15 regarding any sentence credit being sought and ADA Trigg to respond by 9/8/15.  DE's driving privileges are revoked for 12 months.  AODA Assessment & Ignition Interlock ordered.  Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.  (Request to return money being held in evidence is granted, but not the phone or tablet)

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Denise Hertz McGrath.  Clerk: PT
Case is resolved.  Counts 1, 2 & 3 - DE pleads No Contest; found guilty by the court.  Counts 4 through 12 are Dismissed by the State.  PSI ordered.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 11, 2015 at 11:00 am.
